intro: Chrysochosma cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban goldenstar, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and tendrils typical of the family. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in open areas with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
